ygData.subject: Re: Confession Of a Monk
ygData.msgSnippet: Aye, u re rite. but ranger would have not problem with getting their stuff back. Camo helps alot. heheh. Monk is good as they are their own armor and weapon.
ygData.messageBody:
Aye, u're rite. but ranger would have not problem with getting their
stuff back. Camo helps alot. heheh. Monk is good as they are their own armor
and weapon.
----- Original Message -----
From: Wilson <ritzbits@...>
To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, May 23, 1999 16:32
Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] Confession Of a Monk


> From: "Wilson" <ritzbits@...>
>
> Look at those LvL 20 and above Warriors,Rangers,Wizards standing in groups
> in banded armour with well-balanced weapons. Impressive right? And they
keep
> going : /shout You better get the hell outta there before train comes blah
> blah blah <big talk>. I am powerful etc...
>
> Lets take a look after they die in the deep deep dungeons....
>
> XXX : Errr....couldst any spare me a rusty weapon? Perhaps even some
> PatchWork?
> They are almost useless without their armour and weapon, when they go to
> retrieve their things in Dungeons etc. I doubt those LvL 20+ even get pass
> those Elite/Guards Gnolls. That means 300PP worth of things gone?
>
> Lets take a look at the Monks now...
>
> Mr-I-Wear-Only-Cloth stands alone in the dungeon and dies. But he just
need
> some food to get everything going right. The Monks can just fight their
way
> through to where they died without worries and EASILY. Been there, done
> that. And at the same time kick some ass while on their journey. Whereas
> those other classes take big detours around monsters to avoid being killed
> and trying to retrieve corpse.
>
> Ok, enough of my biase remarks now.
>
> Wilson aka Yutaka
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Alex <leealex@...>
> Why I choose to play a monk ...... <Snip> <Pai seh>
>
